alert.note: Alert for Des Moines (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:13AM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Mercer, Henderson, Louisa and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Muscatine, Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Mississippi River at Burlington affecting Henderson, Hancock, Lee and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Henderson and Des Moines Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jo Daviess, Jackson and Dubuque Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Muscatine, Louisa, Mercer and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Clinton, Scott, Rock Island and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Clinton, Whiteside and Carroll Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 13.2 feet Wednesday morning. Additional rises are expected through the end of April. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this evening.
